bill_title: prohibit and penalize certain alien employment.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit and penalize certain alien employment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 60-1 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No employer may employ an alien whom the employer knows is not a citizen of the United States and not in possession of Form I-151, Alien Registration Receipt Card or any other document issued by the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service or the Attorney General of the United States which authorizes the alien to work. Any employer who violates this Act is subject to a civil penalty of up to two thousand five hundred dollars for each day this Act is violated. The civil penalty shall be imposed by the Secretary of the Department of Labor after notice and hearing according to the contested case procedure authorized in chapter 1-26. Any person aggrieved by the assessment of a civil penalty may appeal the assessment according to the contested case appeal procedure authorized in chapter 1-26. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
